verses.verse: And <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, looking <S%G816><s%> stedfastly on the council <S%G4892><s%>, said <S%G2036><s%>, <S%G435><s%> Brethren <S%G80><s%>, I <S%G1473><s%> have lived <S%G4176><s%> before God <S%G2316><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> conscience <S%G4893><s%> until <S%G891><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> day <S%G2250><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> the high priest <S%G749><s%> Ananias <S%G367><s%> commanded <S%G2004><s%> them that <S%G3588><s%> stood by <S%G3936><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to smite <S%G5180><s%> him <S%G846><s%> on the mouth <S%G4750><s%>.

Then <S%G5119><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, God <S%G2316><s%> shall <S%G3195><s%> smite <S%G5180><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>, thou whited <S%G2867><s%> wall <S%G5109><s%>: and <S%G2532><s%> sittest <S%G2521><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> to judge <S%G2919><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the law <S%G3551><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> commandest <S%G2753><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> to be smitten <S%G5180><s%> contrary to the law <S%G3891><s%>?
And <S%G1161><s%> they that <S%G3588><s%> stood by <S%G3936><s%> said <S%G2036><s%>, Revilest <S%G3058><s%> thou God <S%G2316><s%>'s high priest <S%G749><s%>?

And <S%G5037><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> said <S%G5346><s%>, I knew <S%G1492><s%> not <S%G3756><s%>, brethren <S%G80><s%>, that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> high priest <S%G749><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> it is written <S%G1125><s%>, Thou shalt <S%G2046><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> speak <S%G2046><s%> evil <S%G2560><s%> of a ruler <S%G758><s%> of thy <S%G4675><s%> people <S%G2992><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> perceived <S%G1097><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> the one <S%G1520><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> were <S%G2076><s%> Sadducees <S%G4523><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> the other <S%G2087><s%> Pharisees <S%G5330><s%>, he cried out <S%G2896><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%>, Brethren <S%G80><s%>, I <S%G1473><s%> am <S%G1510><s%> a Pharisee <S%G5330><s%>, a son <S%G5207><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> Pharisees <S%G5330><s%>: touching the hope <S%G1680><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> resurrection <S%G386><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> the dead <S%G3498><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> am called in question <S%G2919><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when <S%G5124><s%> he <S%G846><s%> had so said <S%G2980><s%>, there arose <S%G1096><s%> a dissension <S%G4714><s%> between the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Sadducees <S%G4523><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> the assembly <S%G4128><s%> was divided <S%G4977><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> the Sadducees4523, Ezekiel3 say that <S%G3004><s%> there is <S%G1511><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> resurrection <S%G386><s%>, neither <S%G3366><s%> angel <S%G32><s%>, nor <S%G3383><s%> spirit <S%G4151><s%>; but <S%G1161><s%> the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> confess <S%G3670><s%> both <S%G297><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> there arose <S%G1096><s%> a great <S%G3173><s%> clamor <S%G2532><s%>: and some of the scribes <S%G1122><s%> of the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> stood up <S%G450><s%>, and strove <S%G1264><s%>, saying <S%G3004><s%>, We find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> man <S%G444><s%>: and what <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> a spirit <S%G4151><s%> hath spoken <S%G2980><s%> to him <S%G846><s%>, or <S%G2228><s%> an angel <S%G32><s%>?

And <S%G1161><s%> when there arose <S%G1096><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> dissension <S%G4714><s%>, the chief captain <S%G5506><s%>, fearing <S%G2125><s%> lest <S%G3361><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> should be torn in pieces <S%G1288><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, commanded <S%G2753><s%> the soldiers <S%G4753><s%> to go down <S%G2597><s%> and take <S%G726><s%> him <S%G846><s%> by force <S%G726><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> among <S%G3319><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, and <S%G5037><s%> bring <S%G71><s%> him into <S%G1519><s%> the castle <S%G3925><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> the night <S%G3571><s%> following <S%G1966><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> stood <S%G2186><s%> by him <S%G846><s%>, and said <S%G2036><s%>, Be of good cheer <S%G2293><s%>: <S%G3972><s%> for <S%G1063><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> thou hast testified <S%G1263><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> me <S%G1700><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2419><s%>, so <S%G3779><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> thou <S%G4571><s%> bear witness <S%G3140><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Rome <S%G4516><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when it was <S%G1096><s%> day <S%G2250><s%>, <S%G5100><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> banded <S%G4160><s%> together <S%G4963><s%>, and bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> under a curse <S%G332><s%>, saying that <S%G3004><s%> they would <S%G5315><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> drink <S%G4095><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> they <S%G3739><s%> had killed <S%G615><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>.
And <S%G1161><s%> they were <S%G2258><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than forty <S%G5062><s%> that <S%G3588><s%> made <S%G4160><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> conspiracy <S%G4945><s%>.

And they <S%G3748><s%> came <S%G4334><s%> to the chief priests <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the elders <S%G4245><s%>, and said <S%G2036><s%>, We have bound <S%G332><s%> ourselves <S%G1438><s%> under a <S%G3739><s%> great curse <S%G331><s%>, to taste <S%G1089><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> we have killed <S%G615><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>.

Now <S%G3568><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> do ye <S%G5210><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%> signify <S%G1718><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%> that <S%G3704><s%> he bring <S%G2609><s%> him <S%G846><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> you <S%G5209><s%>, as though <S%G5613><s%> ye would <S%G3195><s%> judge <S%G1231><s%> of his <S%G846><s%> case <S%G4012><s%> more exactly <S%G199><s%>: and <S%G1161><s%> we <S%G2249><s%>, before <S%G4253><s%> he <S%G846><s%> comes near <S%G1448><s%>, are <S%G2070><s%> ready <S%G2092><s%> to slay <S%G337><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>'s sister <S%G79><s%>'s son <S%G5207><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of their lying in wait <S%G1749><s%>, and he came <S%G3854><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the castle <S%G3925><s%> and told <S%G518><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> unto him one <S%G1520><s%> of the centurions <S%G1543><s%>, and said <S%G5346><s%>, Bring <S%G520><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young man <S%G3494><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%>; for <S%G1063><s%> he hath <S%G2192><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

So3767, Ezekiel3 he took <S%G3880><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, and brought <S%G71><s%> him to <S%G4314><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> saith <S%G5346><s%>, Paul <S%G3972><s%> the prisoner <S%G1198><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> unto <S%G4341><s%> him <S%G2065><s%>, and asked me to bring <S%G71><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young man <S%G3494><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>, who hath <S%G2192><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to say <S%G2980><s%> to thee <S%G4671><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> the chief captain <S%G5506><s%> took <S%G1949><s%> him <S%G846><s%> by the hand <S%G5495><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> going <S%G402><s%> aside <S%G2596><s%> asked <S%G4441><s%> him privately <S%G2398><s%>, What <S%G5101><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> it that <S%G3739><s%> thou hast <S%G2192><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> me <S%G3427><s%>?

And <S%G1161><s%> he said <S%G3754><s%>, The Jews <S%G2453><s%> have agreed <S%G4934><s%> to ask <S%G2065><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%> to <S%G3704><s%> bring down <S%G2609><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to-morrow <S%G839><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> the council <S%G4892><s%>, as though <S%G5613><s%> thou wouldest inquire <S%G4441><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> more <S%G3195><s%> exactly <S%G199><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

<S%G3767><s%> Do <S%G3982><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> therefore yield <S%G3982><s%> unto them <S%G846><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> there lie in wait <S%G1748><s%> for him <S%G846><s%> of <S%G1537><s%> them <S%G846><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than forty <S%G5062><s%> men <S%G435><s%>, who <S%G3748><s%> have bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> under a curse <S%G332><s%>, <S%G3739><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> to <S%G5315><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> to drink <S%G4095><s%> till2193, 3739 they have slain <S%G337><s%> him <S%G846><s%>: and <S%G2532><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> are they <S%G1526><s%> ready <S%G2092><s%>, looking for <S%G4327><s%> the promise <S%G1860><s%> from <S%G575><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%>.

So3767, Ezekiel3 the chief captain <S%G5506><s%> let <S%G630><s%> the young man <S%G3494><s%> go <S%G630><s%>, charging <S%G3853><s%> him <S%G1583><s%>, Tell no man <S%G3367><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> thou hast signified <S%G1718><s%> these things <S%G5023><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> me <S%G3165><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> he <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> unto him two <S%G1417><s%> of the centurions <S%G1543><s%>, and said <S%G2036><s%>, Make ready <S%G2090><s%> two hundred <S%G1250><s%> soldiers <S%G4757><s%> to <S%G3704><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> as far as <S%G2193><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> horsemen <S%G2460><s%> threescore and ten <S%G1440><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> spearmen <S%G1187><s%> two hundred <S%G1250><s%>, at <S%G575><s%> the third <S%G5154><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> of the night <S%G3571><s%>:

and <S%G5037><s%> he bade them provide <S%G3936><s%> beasts <S%G2934><s%>, that <S%G2443><s%> they might set <S%G1913><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> thereon <S%G1913><s%>, and bring <S%G1295><s%> him safe <S%G1295><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%> the governor <S%G2232><s%>.
And he wrote <S%G1125><s%> a letter <S%G1992><s%> after <S%G4023><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> form <S%G5179><s%>:
Claudius <S%G2804><s%> Lysias <S%G3079><s%> unto the most excellent <S%G2903><s%> governor <S%G2232><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%>, greeting <S%G5463><s%>.

This <S%G5126><s%> man <S%G435><s%> was seized <S%G4815><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> was about <S%G5259><s%> to be slain <S%G337><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, when I <S%G2186><s%> came upon them with <S%G4862><s%> the soldiers <S%G4753><s%> and rescued <S%G1807><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, having learned <S%G3129><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%> a Roman <S%G4514><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> desiring <S%G1014><s%> to know <S%G1097><s%> the cause156, 1223 wherefore <S%G3739><s%> they accused <S%G1458><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, I brought <S%G2609><s%> him <S%G846><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> their <S%G846><s%> council <S%G4892><s%>:

whom <S%G3739><s%> I found <S%G2147><s%> to be accused <S%G1458><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> of their <S%G846><s%> law <S%G3551><s%>, but <S%G1161><s%> to have <S%G2192><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> laid to his charge <S%G1462><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of bonds <S%G1199><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> when it was shown <S%G3377><s%> to me3427, 5259 that <S%G2071><s%> there would <S%G3195><s%> be a <S%G3195><s%> plot against the man <S%G435><s%>, I sent <S%G3992><s%> him to <S%G4314><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%> forthwith <S%G1824><s%>, charging <S%G3853><s%> his accusers <S%G2725><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to speak <S%G3004><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%>.

So3767, Ezekiel3 the soldiers <S%G4757><s%>, as <S%G2596><s%> it was commanded <S%G1299><s%> them <S%G846><s%>, took <S%G353><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> and brought <S%G71><s%> him by <S%G1223><s%> night <S%G3571><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Antipatris <S%G494><s%>.

But on <S%G1161><s%> the morrow <S%G1887><s%> they left <S%G1439><s%> the horsemen <S%G2460><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, and returned <S%G5290><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> the castle <S%G3925><s%>:

and <S%G2532><s%> they <S%G1525><s%>, when they came to <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> delivered <S%G325><s%> the letter <S%G1992><s%> to the governor <S%G2232><s%>, presented <S%G3936><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> before him <S%G846><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> when <S%G1161><s%> he <S%G2232><s%> had read <S%G314><s%> it <S%G1905><s%>, he asked of <S%G1537><s%> what <S%G4169><s%> province <S%G1885><s%> he was <S%G2076><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> when he understood <S%G4441><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> he was of <S%G575><s%> Cilicia <S%G2791><s%>,

I will hear <S%G1251><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%> fully <S%G5346><s%>, said he, when <S%G3752><s%> thine <S%G4675><s%> accusers <S%G2725><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> are come <S%G3854><s%>: and <S%G5037><s%> he commanded <S%G2753><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to be kept <S%G5442><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> Herod <S%G2264><s%>'s palace <S%G4232><s%>.
